methods.name: clearBlockedBundles
methods.docs:
Clear all blocked bundles from the blocked list.

This removes all bundle identifiers that were automatically blocked
due to rollbacks when `autoBlockRolledBackBundles` is enabled.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: deleteBundle
methods.docs:
Delete a bundle from the app.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: downloadBundle
methods.docs:
Download a bundle.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: fetchLatestBundle
methods.docs:
Fetch the latest bundle using the [Capawesome Cloud](https://capawesome.io/cloud/).

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getBlockedBundles
methods.docs:
Get all blocked bundle identifiers.

Returns the list of bundle identifiers that were automatically blocked
due to rollbacks when `autoBlockRolledBackBundles` is enabled.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getBundles
methods.docs:
Get all identifiers of bundles that have been downloaded.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getChannel
methods.docs:
Get the channel that is used for the update.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getConfig
methods.docs:
Get the runtime configuration.

Returns the current plugin configuration including any runtime
overrides set via `setConfig()`.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getDownloadedBundles
methods.docs:
Get all identifiers of bundles that have been downloaded.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getCurrentBundle
methods.docs:
Get the bundle identifier of the current bundle.
The current bundle is the bundle that is currently used by the app.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getCustomId
methods.docs:
Get the custom identifier of the device.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getDeviceId
methods.docs:
Get the unique device identifier.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: isSyncing
methods.docs:
Check whether a sync operation is currently in progress.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getNextBundle
methods.docs:
Get the bundle identifier of the next bundle.
The next bundle is the bundle that will be used after calling `reload()`
or restarting the app.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getVersionCode
methods.docs:
Get the version code of the app.

On **Android**, this is the `versionCode` from the `android/app/build.gradle` file.
On **iOS**, this is the `CFBundleVersion` from the `Info.plist` file.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: getVersionName
methods.docs:
Get the version name of the app.

On **Android**, this is the `versionName` from the `android/app/build.gradle` file.
On **iOS**, this is the `CFBundleShortVersionString` from the `Info.plist` file.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: ready
methods.docs:
Notify the plugin that the app is ready to use and no rollback is needed.

**Attention**: This method should be called as soon as the app is ready to use
to prevent the app from being reset to the default bundle.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: reload
methods.docs:
Reload the app to apply the new bundle.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: reset
methods.docs:
Reset the app to the default bundle.

Call `reload()` or restart the app to apply the changes.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: resetConfig
methods.docs:
Reset the runtime configuration to the values from the Capacitor config file.

This clears any runtime configuration set via `setConfig()`.
The changes take effect immediately.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: setChannel
methods.docs:
Set the channel to use for the update.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: setConfig
methods.docs:
Set the runtime configuration.

This allows updating plugin configuration options at runtime.
The changes are persisted across app restarts and take effect immediately.

**Important:** Runtime configuration is automatically reset to default values
whenever the native app is updated to a new version. This ensures that
configuration from previous versions doesn't persist after an app update.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: setCustomId
methods.docs:
Set the custom identifier of the device.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: setNextBundle
methods.docs:
Set the next bundle to use for the app.

Call `reload()` or restart the app to apply the changes.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: sync
methods.docs:
Automatically download and set the latest bundle for the app using the [Capawesome Cloud](https://capawesome.io/cloud/).

Call `reload()` or restart the app to apply the changes.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: addListener
methods.docs:
Listen for the download progress of a bundle.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: addListener
methods.docs:
Listen for when a bundle is set as the next bundle.

This event is triggered whenever a bundle is set to be used on the next app restart,
either through automatic updates or manual calls to `setNextBundle()`.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: addListener
methods.docs:
Listen for when the app is reloaded.

This event is triggered after the `reload()` method is called
and the app has been reloaded.

**Note:** To verify whether an update was successfully applied after a reload,
use the `ready()` method instead. The `ready()` method provides detailed information
about the current bundle, previous bundle, and whether a rollback occurred.

Only available on Android and iOS.

methods.name: removeAllListeners
methods.docs: Remove all listeners for this plugin.

properties.name: bundleId
properties.docs: The unique identifier of the bundle to delete.

properties.name: artifactType
properties.docs: The artifact type of the bundle.

properties.name: bundleId
properties.docs:
The unique identifier of the bundle.

**Attention**: The value `public` is reserved and cannot be used as a bundle identifier.

properties.name: checksum
properties.docs:
The checksum of the self-hosted bundle as a SHA-256 hash
in base64 format to verify the integrity of the bundle.

**Attention**: Only supported for the `zip` artifact type.

properties.name: signature
properties.docs:
The signature of the self-hosted bundle as a signed SHA-256 hash
in base64 format to verify the integrity of the bundle.

**Attention**: Only supported for the `zip` artifact type.

properties.name: url
properties.docs:
The URL of the bundle to download.

For the `zip` artifact type, the URL must point to a ZIP file.
For the `manifest` artifact type, the URL serves as the base URL
to download the individual files. For example, if the URL is
`https://example.com/download`, the plugin will download the file
with the href `index.html` from `https://example.com/download?href=index.html`.

To **verify the integrity** of the file, the server should return
a `X-Checksum` header with the SHA-256 hash in base64 format.

To **verify the signature** of the file, the server should return
a `X-Signature` header with the signed SHA-256 hash in base64 format.

properties.name: artifactType
properties.docs: The artifact type of the bundle.

properties.name: bundleId
properties.docs:
The unique identifier of the latest bundle.

If `null`, no bundle is available.

properties.name: checksum
properties.docs:
The checksum of the latest bundle if the bundle is self-hosted.

If the bundle is hosted on Capawesome Cloud, the checksum will be
returned as response header when downloading the bundle.

properties.name: customProperties
properties.docs: Custom properties that are associated with the latest bundle.

properties.name: downloadUrl
properties.docs:
The URL of the latest bundle to download.
Pass this URL to the `downloadBundle(...)` method to download the bundle.

properties.name: signature
properties.docs:
The signature of the latest bundle if the bundle is self-hosted.

If the bundle is hosted on Capawesome Cloud, the signature will be
returned as response header when downloading the bundle.

properties.name: channel
properties.docs: The name of the channel where the latest bundle is fetched from.

properties.name: bundleIds
properties.docs: An array of unique identifiers of all blocked bundles.

properties.name: bundleIds
properties.docs: An array of unique identifiers of all available bundles.

properties.name: channel
properties.docs:
The channel name.

If `null`, the app is using the default channel.

properties.name: appId
properties.docs:
The app ID used to identify the app.

If `null`, no app ID is configured.

properties.name: autoUpdateStrategy
properties.docs: The auto-update strategy for live updates.

properties.name: bundleIds
properties.docs: An array of unique identifiers of all downloaded bundles.

properties.name: bundleId
properties.docs:
The unique identifier of the current bundle.

If `null`, the default bundle is being used.

properties.name: customId
properties.docs:
The custom identifier of the device.

If `null`, no custom identifier is set.

properties.name: deviceId
properties.docs:
The unique identifier of the device.

On iOS, [`identifierForVendor`](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uidevice/1620059-identifierforvendor) is used.
The value of this property is the same for apps that come from the same vendor running on the same device.

properties.name: syncing
properties.docs: Whether a sync operation is currently in progress.

properties.name: bundleId
properties.docs:
The unique identifier of the next bundle.

If `null`, the default bundle is being used.

properties.name: versionCode
properties.docs:
The version code of the app.

On **Android**, this is the `versionCode` from the `android/app/build.gradle` file.
On **iOS**, this is the `CFBundleVersion` from the `Info.plist` file.

properties.name: versionName
properties.docs:
The version name of the app.

On **Android**, this is the `versionName` from the `android/app/build.gradle` file.
On **iOS**, this is the `CFBundleShortVersionString` from the `Info.plist` file.

properties.name: previousBundleId
properties.docs:
The identifier of the previous bundle used.

If `null`, the default bundle was used.

properties.name: currentBundleId
properties.docs:
The identifier of the current bundle used.

If `null`, the default bundle is being used.

properties.name: rollback
properties.docs: Whether or not the app was reset to the default bundle.

properties.name: channel
properties.docs:
The channel name.

Set `null` to remove the channel.

properties.name: appId
properties.docs:
The app ID used to identify the app.

Set `null` to reset to the value from the Capacitor config file.

properties.name: customId
properties.docs:
The custom identifier of the device.

Set `null` to remove the custom identifier.

properties.name: bundleId
properties.docs:
The unique identifier of the bundle to use.

Set `null` to use the default bundle (same as calling `reset()`).

properties.name: nextBundleId
properties.docs:
The identifier of the next bundle to use.

If `null`, the app is up-to-date and no new bundle is available.

properties.name: channel
properties.docs: The name of the channel where the latest bundle is fetched from.

interfaces.name: DownloadBundleProgressEvent
interfaces.docs: Event that is triggered when the download progress of a bundle changes.

properties.name: bundleId
properties.docs: The unique identifier of the bundle that is being downloaded.

properties.name: downloadedBytes
properties.docs: The number of bytes that have been downloaded.

properties.name: progress
properties.docs: The progress of the download in percent as a value between `0` and `1`.

properties.name: totalBytes
properties.docs: The total number of bytes to download.

interfaces.name: NextBundleSetEvent
interfaces.docs: Event that is triggered when a bundle is set as the next bundle.

properties.name: bundleId
properties.docs:
The unique identifier of the bundle that is set as the next bundle.

If `null`, the default bundle will be used.

typeAliases.name: DownloadBundleProgressListener
typeAliases.docs: Listener for the download progress of a bundle.

typeAliases.name: NextBundleSetListener
typeAliases.docs: Listener for when a bundle is set as the next bundle.

typeAliases.name: ReloadedListener
typeAliases.docs: Listener for when the app is reloaded.

properties.name: appId
properties.docs:
The app ID is used to identify the app when using [Capawesome Cloud](https://capawesome.io/cloud/).

This is **NOT** the same as the app identifier (e.g. `com.example.app`).
This is a unique identifier generated by Capawesome Cloud (e.g. `6e351b4f-69a7-415e-a057-4567df7ffe94`).

properties.name: autoBlockRolledBackBundles
properties.docs:
Whether or not to automatically block bundles that have been rolled back.

When enabled, the plugin will automatically block bundles that caused a rollback
(up to 100 bundles). When the limit is reached, the oldest blocked bundle is unblocked.
Blocked bundles will be skipped in future sync operations.

**Attention**: This option has no effect if `readyTimeout` is set to `0`.

Only available on Android and iOS.

properties.name: autoDeleteBundles
properties.docs:
Whether or not to automatically delete unused bundles.

When enabled, the plugin will automatically delete unused bundles after calling `ready()`.

properties.name: autoUpdateStrategy
properties.docs:
The auto-update strategy for live updates.

- `none`: Live updates will not be applied automatically.
- `background`: Live updates will be automatically downloaded
and applied in the background at app startup and when the app resumes
(if the last check was more than 15 minutes ago).

Only available on Android and iOS.

properties.name: defaultChannel
properties.docs: The default channel of the app.

properties.name: httpTimeout
properties.docs: The timeout in milliseconds for HTTP requests.

properties.name: publicKey
properties.docs:
The public key to verify the integrity of the bundle.

The public key must be a PEM-encoded RSA public key.

properties.name: readyTimeout
properties.docs:
The timeout in milliseconds to wait for the app to be ready
before resetting to the default bundle.

It is strongly **recommended** to configure this option (e.g. `10000` ms)
so that the plugin can roll back to the default bundle in case of problems.
If configured, the plugin will wait for the app to call the `ready()`
method before resetting to the default bundle.

Set to `0` to disable the timeout.

properties.name: serverDomain
properties.docs: The API domain of the [Capawesome Cloud](https://cloud.capawesome.io) server **without** scheme or path.
